instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.CPUIMVP_VR_ON: What is CPUIMVP_VR_ON? CPUIMVP_VR_ON is a signal that tells the buck converter responsible for PPVCORE_S0_CPU to turn on and create CPU vcore voltage. This comes from ALL_SYS_PWRGD â€“ once ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present, CPUIMVP_VR_ON will be present. .
definitions.CPUIMVP_PGOOD: What is CPUIMVP_PGOOD? CPUIMVP_PGOOD is a signal from the CPU VCORE buck converter IC that indicates CPU power is good which is necessary to create PM_S0_PGOOD..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
came in with water damage around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> repaired some traces and replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
after that I took the board to Louis and it just turned on,,, around the right fan where its connected to the board the screw bracket is broken off.

today I had some time and picked up the board again,.

found a short on <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> after replacing it short is gone.

now I also have <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> back.

no fan spin and no vcore

<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_TON</SIGNAL> both resistors measure good 181.9k and 182,1k
also when measuring from the pin 1 red and pin 48 black 364k

any idear where to go next.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
no cpuvcore

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>  present


<CHIP>U7950</CHIP>

pin 1 0.021v
pin 2 0.064v
pin 3  0
pin 4 0
pin 5 0
pin 6 0
pin 7 0
pin 8 3.3

missing <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_PGOOD</SIGNAL>
missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_PGOOD</SIGNAL> comes from <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
pin 46 5v
    29 5v
    19 5v

<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> enables the <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> chip


<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> comes from  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>

<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>
pin 1 0.002v  <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_VMON</SIGNAL>  
pin 2 un NC  
pin 3 0.020v ground  
pin 4 0.020v <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 
pin 5 1.068v <SIGNAL>VMON_3V3_DIV</SIGNAL> 
pin 6 3.27v <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_VMON</SIGNAL>
pin 7 0 <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3RS0_VMON</SIGNAL>
pin 8 2.7v NC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, cames from the point where <RESISTOR>R7967</RESISTOR> is tied to <RESISTOR>R7963</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R7969</RESISTOR>, if one of the PGOOD signals is not coming high this will pull down <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.... Measure big coils and check what voltage is missing.....

ill check them thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message:
oke wanted to measure today, I pluged in the board and had 0 on the first few resitors.
I then stoped and went back to the power lines.
when I came to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> I got 0 at probing one of the caps.

when I released the probe the fan started to spin.

I then unplugged to see if I could reproduce. tobad no.

but now I don't have any volts at
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>             0.020v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>             0.094v

I got 3.34 volts at <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: You are measuring S0 voltages while S3 is not even there. Is <SIGNAL>SLP_S4</SIGNAL> high?

yes I measured it again because it was present before. s5->s3>s0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no fan spin no chime, mouse lights up
threads.message: Corrosion somewhere. Impossible to remotely diagnose, inspect all areas that had corrosion. Maybe under SMC if there was corrosion there.
